bioghist.p: John Bach McMaster (1852-1932) was a prominent historian and professor of American history at the University of Pennsylvania. He graduated from the college of the City of New York in 1872, worked as a civil engineer from 1873 to 1877, and was an instructor in civil engineering at Princeton University from 1877 to 1883, when he joined the faculty of the University of Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of stamps, currency, diplomas, and newspaper clippings. Materials include: Confederate States currency, 1862-1864; Confederate postage; canceled U.S. and foreign stamps; greenbacks (U.S. five dollar bills), 1878; Continental currency, 1772-1777, from Delaware, Maryland, New Jersey, and Pennsylvania; United States fractional currency, 1863-1879; bank notes, 1817-1862; lottery tickets, 1829-1865; 1848 newspaper clipping about the telegraph and and 1865 article about Grant and Sherman; and a 1789 University of Glasgow diploma.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
